andromeda.why: Refuses coerced fights; sovereignty chooses if a struggle is worthy.

arcturus.why: Initial risk/fitness check—don’t deploy force until the frame is sound.

draco.why: Picking fights to assert rank rather than meaning.

lyra.why: This is a meaning/force axis, not an aesthetic one.

orion-dark.why: Using opposition to compel obedience or fear.

orion-light.why: Warrior discipline: conserve strength for the right cause.

pleiades.why: Reads human cost so the fight doesn’t harm the tribe.

sirius.why: Pre-teaching struggle hygiene; no formal transmission yet.

andromeda.why: Declines forced ‘necessary’ battles; protects free consent.

arcturus.why: Places people/effort where opposition yields real gain—viability first.

draco.why: Loyalty tests around ‘prove you’ll fight for us.’

lyra.why: Sober, inspiring framing clarifies the cause without theatrics.

orion-dark.why: Etiquette or protocol used to mask coercion into conflict.

orion-light.why: Choose the honorable contest; ignore bait and spectacle.

pleiades.why: Attunes to bonds so the struggle remains humane.

sirius.why: Practical selection of battles; not yet a teaching channel.

andromeda.why: Reclaims choice after misdirected or manipulated contests.

arcturus.why: Regulation wobble—over/under-committing while learning what’s worthy.

draco.why: Predatory provocation—fighting to dominate, not to liberate.

orion-dark.why: Dogma of conflict—manufacturing enemies to tighten control.

orion-light.why: Ordeal of correction: admit misreads, reset aims, engage cleanly.

pleiades.why: Appeasement fights—swinging to ‘keep peace’ rather than truth.

sirius.why: Self-forging via trial-and-error; no law transmission yet.

andromeda.why: Advocates freedom by selecting struggles that actually restore sovereignty.

arcturus.why: Turns opposition into protocol—criteria, thresholds, disengage rules.

draco.why: Guards perimeter so predation doesn’t hijack the fight.

lyra.why: Composed cadence makes the stand receivable by many.

orion-dark.why: Orthodoxy risk—‘one right way’ to resist can erase nuance.

pleiades.why: Keeps the human heart intact while pursuing the stand.

sirius.why: ‘Worthy struggle’ protocol—teaches how to oppose without becoming what you oppose.

andromeda.why: Resists propaganda that sanctifies pointless sacrifice.

arcturus.why: Projected as fixer/warrior-for-all → burnout & scapegoat when refusing bad fights.

draco.why: Status contests about who will ‘fight hardest’ for rank.

lyra.why: Iconic steadiness that inspires without theater.

orion-dark.why: Doctrine of conflict used to compel obedience.

orion-light.why: Integrity under projection—only fight for the true cause.

pleiades.why: Enmeshment—joining battles to be liked or to calm others.

sirius.why: Instruction-by-presence: ethical opposition despite pressure and mythmaking.

andromeda.why: Frees communities from endless, meaningless conflict; restores choice.

arcturus.why: Elder standards for when/how to oppose—readiness, proportionality, review.

draco.why: Legacy rank can ossify into ‘eternal enemies’ narratives.

lyra.why: Quiet, dignified stance becomes a cultural signal for meaning-first courage.

orion-dark.why: Canonizing conflict as identity and hierarchy.

orion-light.why: Warrior elder—fights only when it gives life meaning; refuses spectacle.

pleiades.why: Focus is standards of resistance, not bonding/soothing at this altitude.

sirius.why: Meaning-struggle sage—teaches the law of worthy opposition by embodied example.
